result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry A Forcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay $100.00 today.  Balance payable at the rate of $25.00 per month, starting 10/1/15 and on the same day thereafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry A Forcia

defendant.name: Forcia, Terry A
defendant.address: 214 S 3rd Street #2, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Difranco & Associates PC for documents

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Dominguez.  Defendant plead no contest to the charge.  Victim notification complied with, per State.  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties of the charge she plead to.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights. Court found that a factual basis exists for plea.  Find guilty of count 1.  Joint recommendation for $50, plus costs.  Court ordered $50, plus costs.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  $100 due today.  Balance payable at the rate of $25/mo. starting 10/1/15.   Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Attorney Dominguez appeared with defendant.  Set for plea/sentencing.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.
